{"step_by_step_thinking": "To determine which of the following anticholinergic agents does not cross the blood brain barrier, we need to refer to the relevant documents. Document [9] provides information on the blood-brain barrier permeation and efflux exclusion of anticholinergics. According to this document, trospium chloride is a quaternary amine that is minimally metabolized, not highly protein-bound, and theoretically should not cross the blood brain barrier. Therefore, the correct answer is C. Hyoscine butylbromide.", "answer_choice": "C"}
